alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 3:06PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Harrison and southwestern Jackson Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 305 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over Biloxi Bay over Biloxi, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, St. Martin, D`iberville, Lyman, Latimer and Gulfport Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 33 and 49. Interstate 110 in Mississippi near mile marker 1, and between mile markers 3 and 4. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
